title: SCRUMMY BURGERS
subtitle: Fun with MySQL databases
text: A burger logger that utilizes MySQL, Node, Express, Handlebars and a homemade ORM. Node and MySQL query and route data while Handlebars generates the page HTML.

title: BACON BUTTON
subtitle: Kanban boards, Github branching, APIs
text: This team project served as an introduction to team-based development. During the development of the application, we became nimble with Github branching, utilized kanban boards, and practiced task delegation. API utilization was a key component of the project.

title: NOMAD TRAVEL APP
subtitle: MVC paradigm, Server-side API
text: This Nomad is a travel planning app that allows users to gather all of their travel information in one place. Keeping track of airline, hotel, and in the future, itinerary information (and beyond).​​

title: FITNESS TRACKER
subtitle: Node, Express, and Mongodb
text: A fitness tracking app that allows users to view, create, and track daily workouts. Created with a Mongo database, a Mongoose schema, and handles routes with Express

title: EMPLOYEE DIRECTORY
subtitle: React, Components, Component States
text: A React based directory that allows users to search for employees by name and filter by a variety of categories.

title: WEATHER DASHBOARD
subtitle: API Practice
text: This homework assignment allowed us to practice utilizing third-party APIs. In this instance, the OpenWeather API provided data that allowed us to retrieve the current weather and upcoming forecast for cities. Features dynamically updated HTML and CSS.
